content:
There is an series of videos on YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlF-CfQhukNnq2kDCw2P_vI5AfXN7egP2) called "Metaprogramming in Lean tutorial". Given they are from 2020, I assume they don't focus on Lean 4.
Is anyone here familiar with them and could tell me how much of the material is still relevant in Lean 4, so I can spend my time wisely?
Thanks!

The introductory ideas are still relevant: what's an expression... what it means to do metaprogramming etc.

The syntax for monadic programming and the overall API has changed too much though

I have seen the GH link you posted but haven't had time to read it. I guess I'll skim the videos and then follow up with the link you provided.
Thanks a lot!
Tom has marked this topic as resolved.
